intro: Lessingia fastigiata, commonly known as the upright lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of white hair, giving them a silvery appearance. Lessingia fastigiata is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
